intro: Mikania capixaba, commonly known as the Brazilian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Mikania capixaba is known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense colonies.
